summary: This document is a Twitter thread discussing a 2016 federal lawsuit filed by 'Jane Doe' against Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein, alleging sexual assault and rape when she was 13 at Epstein's mansion. The thread notes the case was filed but later withdrawn by the plaintiff due to threats.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: The anonymous plaintiff who filed a lawsuit alleging Donald Trump sexually assaulted her on four occasions, culminating in rape at age 13 at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Named as a defendant in the lawsuit, accused of sexual assault and rape of Jane Doe when she was 13 at Epstein's mansion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a defendant in the lawsuit; the alleged rape occurred at his mansion.

persons.name: Ian Madrigal
persons.context: The Twitter user posting the thread about the lawsuit and providing details from the Miami Herald and court documents.

connections.description: Jane Doe alleges Trump sexually assaulted her on four occasions and raped her when she was 13.
The alleged rape occurred at Epstein's mansion, and he is named as a defendant in the lawsuit.
Both are named as co-defendants in the same lawsuit alleging sexual assault of Jane Doe at Epstein's property.

events.title: Lawsuit Filed Against Trump and Epstein
events.description: Jane Doe files a complaint in New York federal court alleging rape, sexual misconduct, and other charges against Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Plaintiff Withdraws Complaint
events.description: Jane Doe withdraws her complaint, stating she was 'afraid to show her face' due to 'numerous threats' against her.

events.title: Twitter Thread Reveals Case Details
events.description: Ian Madrigal posts a Twitter thread discussing the previously filed lawsuit and its details, including sworn declarations from the accuser, a friend, and one of Epstein's recruiters.

locations: New York federal court (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: A lawsuit (Case No. TAB-nu-07673) was filed in 2016 by 'Jane Doe' alleging Donald Trump raped her when she was 13 at Jeffrey Epstein's mansion.
The complaint included three sworn declarations: from Jane Doe, a friend she confided in at the time, and one of Epstein's recruiters.
The case was not dismissed; Jane Doe voluntarily withdrew her complaint on November 4, 2016, citing fear due to 'numerous threats'.
The lawsuit alleged multiple charges including rape, sexual misconduct, criminal sexual acts, sexual abuse, forcible touching, assault, battery, and emotional distress.
The Twitter thread references new details uncovered by the Miami Herald that bolster Jane Doe's story.
